timeline.bodyText: Question: Why these getters return null?
timeline.author: ikhoon

replies.bodyText: My mistake :( I will fix soon.
replies.author: ghkim3221

timeline.bodyText:
Could we make this list compact? e.g.
- Primitive types and their wrapper types: `boolean`, `byte`, .... and `double`
- Well-known JDK classes: `String`, `Enum`, `UUID`, ... and `ZoneOffset`
timeline.author: trustin
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -187,7 +187,17 @@ one of the following supported types:
 - `String`
 - `Enum`
 - `UUID`
+- `Duration`
+- `Instant`
+- `LocalDate`
+- `LocalDateTime`
+- `LocalTime`
+- `OffsetDateTime`
+- `OffsetTime`
 - `Period`
+- `ZonedDateTime`
+- `ZoneId`
+- `ZoneOffset`

replies.bodyText:
Well-known JDK classes: String, Enum, UUID, ... and ZoneOffset seems abbreviated.
How about this?
e.g:
- Primitive types and their wrapper types:
  - `boolean` or `Boolean`
  - `byte` or `Byte`
  - `short` or `Short`
  - `integer` or `Integer`
  - `long` or `Long`
  - `float` or `Float`
  - `double` or `Double`
- Well-known JDK classes:
  - `String`
  - `Enum`
  - `UUID`
  - `java.time` package classes

OR, this PR does not support some java.time classes (Clock, MonthDay, Year). In this aspect, it seems better to show clearly.
  - `java.time` package classes
    - `Instant`
    - `Duration` and  `Period`
    - `LocalDate`, `LocalDateTime` and `LocalTime`, 
    - `OffsetDateTime` and `OffsetTime`
    - `ZonedDateTime`, `ZoneId` and `ZoneOffset`

How do you think?
replies.author: ghkim3221

replies.bodyText: The nested list with detailed list of java.time classes sounds good to me.
replies.author: trustin

timeline.message: Add java.time types to supported element types
